aboutMe.metadescription: Learn more about Armando, a passionate Web Developer with a strong background in modern web technologies and continuous learning.
aboutMe.title: About Me
aboutMe.description: Web developer in training with a strong passion for technology and continuous learning. Four years ago, I began my programming journey through online courses, starting with Python and exploring from the basics of HTML and CSS to more advanced frameworks such as Django, Flask, and Tkinter. Over time, I discovered new learning platforms like Udemy, Platzi, and Coursera, which allowed me to expand my stack with modern technologies: JavaScript, React, Next.js, Tailwind, Git/GitHub, SQL and NoSQL databases, along with solid foundations in software engineering. Recently, I completed the Meta Front-End Developer Certificate (Coursera), where I built practical projects with React, applied UX/UI principles, and developed a capstone project that integrated all my learning.

certifications.title: Certifications
certifications.platzi: I studied web development fundamentals and more with courses from Platzi. I learned to build responsive websites and web applications using the latest technologies.
certifications.metaFrontend: I completed the Meta Front-End Developer specialization on Coursera, where I gained advanced front-end development skills, including React, JavaScript, and responsive design.
certifications.udemy: I completed several courses on Udemy, including a full course on Flutter and Dart, where I learned to develop cross-platform mobile applications with attractive and functional interfaces.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Some of my personal projects, where I have applied my skills in Web and Mobile development.

pokemon.title: Fetching Pokémon Data
pokemon.description: A project about retrieving Pokémon data using the Pokémon API. Popular in web programming courses and a basic exercise to understand REST API consumption.

web_duo.title: Web Duo Corazon
web_duo.description: Website for a circus artist duo (Duo Corazon). Consists of three main sections with an attractive design and image gallery.

web_theliazeed.title: Web The Liazeed
web_theliazeed.description: Website for an entertainment company that offers a variety of artistic performances across Europe.

teslo_shop.title: Teslo Shop
teslo_shop.description: An e-commerce platform for selling sneakers, built with Next.js and Tailwind CSS. Features include user authentication, product management, and payment processing with PayPal. Utilizes a PostgreSQL database with Prisma as ORM.

my_Tree.title: My Tree Web Application
my_Tree.description: A web application for managing family trees, where you can build a bloodline family map by adding direct descendants, built with Next.js and Tailwind CSS. It includes node functionality to visualize the family tree structure.

my_Tree_Screen.heroSubtitle: Visualize your family tree automatically and intuitively

projectDescription.title: About the Project
projectDescription.paragraph1: FamilyTree is an innovative web application designed to simplify the visualization and management of family trees. It allows users to create family connections intuitively, by directly adding parents and children.
projectDescription.paragraph2: The system automatically calculates all blood relationships, identifying uncles, nephews, grandparents, cousins, and other kinships without the user having to manually specify them.

ideacion.title: 1. Ideation and Planning
ideacion.text: Problem identification: difficulty in clearly and automatically visualizing extensive family relationships.

brainstorming.title: 2. Brainstorming and Sketching
brainstorming.text: Definition of key features: Insertion of direct relationships such as children and parents. Automatic calculation of relationships with the user, visualization in nodes.

maquetacion.title: 3. Mockup and Design
maquetacion.text: Design of wireframes and user flows, defining the information architecture and interaction patterns.

prototiping.title: 4. Prototyping and User Testing
prototiping.text: Development of interactive mockups in Figma, UX/UI validation with potential users, and design refinement.

development.title: 5. Development and Implementation
development.text: Implementation with Next.js 15, TypeScript, relationship calculation algorithms, and node visualization. Database with Prisma and Cloudinary for image storage.

login.title: Login and Registration Page
login.text: Simple interface to log in with an existing account or create a new one. Minimalist design that facilitates the authentication process.

home.title: Home with and without User
home.text: Initial landing page that clearly and attractively presents login and registration options for new visitors. Once authenticated, the user will be able to access their profile creation and explore the available functionalities.

familyManagement.title: Family Management
familyManagement.text: Add parents and children using a form where the only required options are name and relationship selection.

autoView.title: Automatic Visualization
autoView.text: Once you add family members, the system automatically calculates and displays all family relationships: uncles, cousins, grandparents, nephews, and more.

development.title: Node View
development.text: Interactive visual representation of the family tree in graph form, allowing for intuitive navigation through generations and visualizing the connections between family members.
